enum_members.name: NONE
enum_members.description:
A mode that does not allow access to any services that require authorization. This mode occurs
when an add-on executes anonOpen(e)simple trigger, and the user has installed an
add-on in a different document but the add-on has not been used in the current document.

enum_members.name: CUSTOM_FUNCTION
enum_members.description:
A mode that allows access to a limited subset of services for use in custom spreadsheet
functions. Some of these services — including read-only access to Spreadsheet service —
normally require authorization, but are permitted without authorization when used in a custom
function. Because custom functions do not include an event parameter, this value is never
returned; it is documented only to demonstrate that custom functions run in their own
authorization mode.

enum_members.name: LIMITED
enum_members.description:
A mode that allows access to a limited subset of services. This mode occurs when an add-on or a
scriptboundto a document executes anonOpen(e)oronEdit(e)simple trigger, except in the case described forNONE.

enum_members.name: FULL
enum_members.description:
A mode that allows access to all services that require authorization. This mode occurs when an
add-on or a script executes as the result of any trigger other than the cases described forLIMITEDorNONE.

methods.name: getAuthorizationStatus()
methods.description:
Gets a value that indicates whether the user needs to authorize this script to use one or more
services (for example,ScriptApp.AuthorizationStatus.REQUIRED).

methods.name: getAuthorizationUrl()
methods.description:
Gets the authorization URL that can be used to grant access to the script. This method returnsnullif no authorization is required. The page at the URL will close automatically if
it is accessed and the script does not require any authorization.

methods.name: getAuthorizedScopes()
methods.description:
Gets a list of authorized scopes for the script. If authorization information is requested for
a specified list of scopes, returns the authorized scopes from the specified list.

enum_members.name: REQUIRED
enum_members.description:
The user needs to authorize this script to use one or more services. In most cases, the script
prompts the user for authorization the next time it runs; however, if the script is published
as anadd-onthat usesinstallable triggers, the trigger runs the
script without prompting for authorization but throws an exception if the script attempts to
call the unauthorized service.

enum_members.name: NOT_REQUIRED
enum_members.description: The user has granted this script all the authorization it currently requires.

methods.name: create()
methods.description: Creates the trigger and returns it.

methods.name: onEventUpdated()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that fires when a calendar entry is created, updated, or deleted.

parameters.name: durationMilliseconds
parameters.description:
The minimum duration (in milliseconds) after the current time when
    the trigger should run.

methods.name: after(durationMilliseconds)
methods.description:
Specifies the minimum duration (in milliseconds) after the current time that the trigger runs.
The actual duration might vary, but won't be less than your specified minimum.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: A Date object representing when the trigger should run.

methods.name: at(date)
methods.description: Specifies when the trigger runs.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The calendar year to schedule the trigger.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description:
The calendar month to schedule the trigger (should be a number between 1 and 12,
    inclusive).

parameters.name: day
parameters.description:
The calendar day to schedule the trigger (should be a number between 1 and 31,
    inclusive).

methods.name: atDate(year, month, day)
methods.description: Specifies that the trigger fires on the given date, by default near midnight (+/- 15 minutes).

parameters.name: hour
parameters.description: The hour at which to fire.

methods.name: atHour(hour)
methods.description: Specifies the hour the trigger at which the trigger runs.

methods.name: create()
methods.description: Creates the trigger.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of days between executions.

methods.name: everyDays(n)
methods.description: Specifies to run the trigger everyndays.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of hours between executions.

methods.name: everyHours(n)
methods.description: Specifies to run the trigger everynhours.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of minutes between executions.

methods.name: everyMinutes(n)
methods.description: Specifies to run the trigger everynminutes.nmust be 1, 5, 10, 15 or 30.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of weeks between executions.

methods.name: everyWeeks(n)
methods.description: Specifies to run the trigger everynweeks.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: The timezone with which to treat time information in the event.

methods.name: inTimezone(timezone)
methods.description:
Specifies the timezone for the specified dates/time when the trigger runs. By default, the
timezone is that of the script.

parameters.name: minute
parameters.description: The minute at which to fire.

methods.name: nearMinute(minute)
methods.description: Specifies the minute at which the trigger runs (plus or minus 15 minutes). IfnearMinute()is not called, a random minute value is used.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The day of the month the trigger should be scheduled for.

methods.name: onMonthDay(day)
methods.description: Specifies the date in the month that the trigger runs.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The day of the week to fire.

methods.name: onWeekDay(day)
methods.description: Specifies the day of the week that the trigger runs.

methods.name: create()
methods.description: Creates and returns the new trigger.

methods.name: onOpen()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the document is opened.

enum_members.name: CLOCK
enum_members.description: The trigger fires once the time-driven event reaches a specific time.

enum_members.name: ON_OPEN
enum_members.description: The trigger fires once the user opens the Google Docs, Sheets, or Forms file.

enum_members.name: ON_EDIT
enum_members.description:
The trigger fires once the user edits the Google Sheets file (for example, by entering a new
value into a cell, which counts as an edit instead of a change).

enum_members.name: ON_FORM_SUBMIT
enum_members.description:
The trigger fires once the user responds to a Google Form. This trigger is available either in
the Google Form itself or in the Google Sheets file that the form sends its responses to.

enum_members.name: ON_CHANGE
enum_members.description:
The trigger fires once the user changes the Google Sheets file (for example, by adding a row,
which counts as a change instead of an edit).

enum_members.name: ON_EVENT_UPDATED
enum_members.description:
The trigger fires once an event gets created, updated, or deleted on the specified Google
Calendar.

methods.name: create()
methods.description: Creates and returns the new trigger.

methods.name: onFormSubmit()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that will fire when a response is submitted to the form.

methods.name: onOpen()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the form's edit view is opened.

enum_members.name: APPS_MARKETPLACE_DOMAIN_ADD_ON
enum_members.description: Add-on was installed by the administrator for the user's domain.

enum_members.name: NONE
enum_members.description: Script is not running as an add-on.

enum_members.name: WEB_STORE_ADD_ON
enum_members.description: Add-on was installed by the user from the Chrome Web Store.

parameters.name: trigger
parameters.description: The trigger to delete.

methods.name: deleteTrigger(trigger)
methods.description: Removes the given trigger so it no longer runs.

parameters.name: authMode
parameters.description:
The authorization mode for which authorization information is requested; in
    almost all cases, the value forauthModeshould beScriptApp.getAuthorizationInfo(ScriptApp.AuthMode.FULL), since no other authorization mode
    requires that users grant authorization.

methods.name: getAuthorizationInfo(authMode)
methods.description:
Gets an object that checks if the user has granted authorization for all the script
requirements. The object also provides an authorization URL for users to grant those
permissions, in case any of the script requirements are not authorized.

parameters.name: authMode
parameters.description:
The authorization mode for which authorization information is requested; in
    almost all cases, the value forauthModeshould beScriptApp.AuthMode.FULL,
    since no other authorization mode requires that users grant authorization.

parameters.name: oAuthScopes
parameters.description: The OAuth scopes for which authorization information is requested.

methods.name: getAuthorizationInfo(authMode, oAuthScopes)
methods.description:
Gets an object that checks if the user has granted authorization for the requested scopes. The
object also provides an authorization URL for users to grant those permissions, in case any of
the requested scopes are not authorized.

methods.name: getIdentityToken()
methods.description:
Gets anOpenID Connectidentity token for the
effective user, if theopenidscope has been granted. This scope is not included
by default, and you must add it as anexplicit scopein the manifest
file to request it. Include the scopeshttps://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.emailorhttps://www.googleapis.com/auth/userinfo.profileto return additional
user information in the token.

methods.name: getInstallationSource()
methods.description:
Returns an enum value that indicates how the script came to be installed as an add-on for the
current user (for example, whether the user installed it personally through the Chrome Web
Store, or whether a domain administrator installed it for all users).

methods.name: getOAuthToken()
methods.description:
Gets the OAuth 2.0access
tokenfor the effective user. If the script's OAuth scopes are sufficient to authorize
another Google API that normally requires its own OAuth flow (likeGoogle Picker), scripts can bypass the
second authorization prompt by passing this token instead. The token expires after a time (a
few minutes at minimum); scripts should handle authorization failures and call this method to
obtain a fresh token when needed.

methods.name: getProjectTriggers()
methods.description: Gets all installable triggers associated with the current project and current user.

methods.name: getScriptId()
methods.description:
Gets the script project's unique ID. This is the preferred method to get the unique identifier
for the script project as opposed togetProjectKey(). This ID can be used in all places
where project key was previously provided.

methods.name: getService()
methods.description: Gets an object used to control publishing the script as a web app.

parameters.name: document
parameters.description: A Google Docs file that may contain installable triggers.

methods.name: getUserTriggers(document)
methods.description:
Gets all installable triggers owned by this user in the given document, for this script or
add-on only. This method cannot be used to see the triggers attached to other scripts.

parameters.name: form
parameters.description: A Google Forms file that may contain installable triggers.

methods.name: getUserTriggers(form)
methods.description:
Gets all installable triggers owned by this user in the given form, for this script or add-on
only. This method cannot be used to see the triggers attached to other scripts.

parameters.name: spreadsheet
parameters.description: A Google Sheets file that may contain installable triggers.

methods.name: getUserTriggers(spreadsheet)
methods.description:
Gets all installable triggers owned by this user in the given spreadsheet, for this script or
add-on only. This method cannot be used to see the triggers attached to other scripts.

methods.name: invalidateAuth()
methods.description:
Invalidates the authorization the effective user has to execute the current script. Used to
invalidate any permissions for the current script. This is especially useful for functions
tagged as one-shot authorization. Since one-shot authorization functions can only be called the
first run after the script has acquired authorization, if you wish to perform an action
afterwards, you must revoke any authorization the script had, so the user can see the
authorization dialog again.

methods.name: newStateToken()
methods.description: Creates a builder for a state token that can be used in a callback API (like an OAuth flow).

parameters.name: functionName
parameters.description:
The function to call when the trigger fires. You can use functions from
    included libraries, such asLibrary.libFunction1.

methods.name: newTrigger(functionName)
methods.description: Begins the process of creating an installable trigger that, when fired, calls a given function.

parameters.name: authMode
parameters.description:
The authorization mode for which script scopes needs to be evaluated, in almost
    all cases, the value forauthModeshould beScriptApp.AuthMode.FULL, since
    no other authorization mode requires that users grant authorization.

methods.name: requireAllScopes(authMode)
methods.description:
Validates if the user has granted consent for all of the scopes requested by the script. Use
this method if an execution flow relies on all of the scopes that a script requests. If any
consents are missing, then this method ends the current execution and renders an authorization
prompt to request the missing consents.

parameters.name: authMode
parameters.description:
The authorization mode for which requested scopes needs to be evaluated, in
    almost all cases, the value forauthModeshould beScriptApp.AuthMode.FULL,
    since no other authorization mode requires that users grant authorization.

parameters.name: oAuthScopes
parameters.description: The OAuth scopes that are required to complete the given execution flow.

methods.name: requireScopes(authMode, oAuthScopes)
methods.description:
Validates if the user has granted consent for the requested scopes. Use this method if an
execution flow relies on one or more services. If any of the specified consents are missing,
then this method ends the current execution and renders an authorization prompt to request the
missing consents. Scopes that are invalid or notrequiredby
the script lead to an error.

methods.name: getProjectKey()
methods.description: Deprecated.usegetScriptId()instead.

methods.name: getScriptTriggers()
methods.description: Deprecated.This function is deprecated and should not be used in new scripts.

methods.name: getUrl()
methods.description:
Returns the URL of the web app, if it has been deployed; otherwise returnsnull. If you
are running the development mode web app, this returns the development mode url.

methods.name: isEnabled()
methods.description: Returnstrueif the script is accessible as a web app.

methods.name: disable()
methods.description: Deprecated.This function is deprecated and should not be used in new scripts.

methods.name: create()
methods.description: Creates the trigger and returns it.

methods.name: onChange()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet's content or structure is changed.

methods.name: onEdit()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet is edited.

methods.name: onFormSubmit()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet has a form submitted to it.

methods.name: onOpen()
methods.description: Specifies a trigger that will fire when the spreadsheet is opened.

methods.name: createToken()
methods.description: Constructs an encrypted string representation of the state token.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the argument

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the value of the argument

methods.name: withArgument(name, value)
methods.description: Adds an argument to the token. This method can be called multiple times.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description:
The name of the callback function, represented as a string without parentheses or
    arguments. You can use functions from included libraries, such asLibrary.libFunction1.

methods.name: withMethod(method)
methods.description: Sets a callback function. The default is a function namedcallback().

parameters.name: seconds
parameters.description: the duration for which the token is valid; the maximum value is3600

methods.name: withTimeout(seconds)
methods.description:
Sets the duration (in seconds) for which the token is valid. The defaults is 60 seconds; the
maximum duration is 3600 seconds (1 hour).

methods.name: getEventType()
methods.description: Returns the event type that the trigger fires on.

methods.name: getHandlerFunction()
methods.description: Returns the function that will be called when the trigger fires.

methods.name: getTriggerSource()
methods.description: Returns the source of events that will cause the trigger to fire.

methods.name: getTriggerSourceId()
methods.description: Returns the id specific to the source.

methods.name: getUniqueId()
methods.description: Returns a unique identifier that can be used to distinguish triggers from each other.

parameters.name: document
parameters.description: the document

methods.name: forDocument(document)
methods.description: Creates and returns aDocumentTriggerBuildertied to the given document.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: the ID for the document

methods.name: forDocument(key)
methods.description: Creates and returns aDocumentTriggerBuildertied to the document with the given ID.

parameters.name: form
parameters.description: the form

methods.name: forForm(form)
methods.description: Creates and returns aFormTriggerBuildertied to the given form.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: the ID for the form

methods.name: forForm(key)
methods.description: Creates and returns aFormTriggerBuildertied to the form with the given ID.

parameters.name: sheet
parameters.description: the spreadsheet

methods.name: forSpreadsheet(sheet)
methods.description: Creates and returns aSpreadsheetTriggerBuildertied to the given spreadsheet.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: the ID for the spreadsheet

methods.name: forSpreadsheet(key)
methods.description:
Creates and returns aSpreadsheetTriggerBuildertied to the spreadsheet with the given
ID.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: email ID of the user calendar the trigger monitors.

methods.name: forUserCalendar(emailId)
methods.description: Returns a builder for building calendar triggers.

methods.name: timeBased()
methods.description: Creates and returns aClockTriggerBuilderfor building time-based triggers.

enum_members.name: SPREADSHEETS
enum_members.description: Google Sheets causes the trigger to fire.

enum_members.name: CLOCK
enum_members.description: A time-driven event causes the trigger to fire.

enum_members.name: FORMS
enum_members.description: Google Forms causes the trigger to fire.

enum_members.name: DOCUMENTS
enum_members.description: Google Docs causes the trigger to fire.

enum_members.name: CALENDAR
enum_members.description: Google Calendar causes the trigger to fire.
